unnormalised: Indian Railways is facing major disruptions due to the ongoing monsoon. Yesterday, 14/07/2024, the Howrah-Mumbai Duronto Express was delayed by 6 hrs because of waterlogging near Igatpuri. Passengers stuck at Kalyan Jn. were understandably frustrated, posting images of flooded tracks on social media.
normalised: Indian Railways is facing major disruptions due to the ongoing monsoon. Yesterday, fourteenth July two thousand and twenty four, the Howrah-Mumbai Duronto Express was delayed by six hours because of waterlogging near Igatpuri. Passengers stuck at Kalyan Junction were understandably frustrated, posting images of flooded tracks on social media.

unnormalised: The Konkan Railway line is particularly affected, with several trains being cancelled between Ratnagiri and Madgaon until 20/07/2024. Railway officials advise checking NTES (National Train Enquiry System) for up-to-date info. Refund requests are being processed, and IRCTC is supposedly offering assistance.
normalised: The Konkan Railway line is particularly affected, with several trains being cancelled between Ratnagiri and Madgaon until twentieth July two thousand and twenty four. Railway officials advise checking N-T-E-S (National Train Enquiry System) for up-to-date info. Refund requests are being processed, and I-R-C-T-C is supposedly offering assistance.

unnormalised: Adding to the chaos, a landslide near Karjat caused the derailment of a goods train. Fortunately, no casualties reported. Repair work is underway, but expect delays on routes connecting Mumbai and Pune. Some long-distance trains, like the Kerala Express, might be rerouted.
normalised: Adding to the chaos, a landslide near Karjat caused the derailment of a goods train. Fortunately, no casualties reported. Repair work is underway, but expect delays on routes connecting Mumbai and Pune. Some long-distance trains, like the Kerala Express, might be rerouted.

unnormalised: Remember to book tickets in 3A or 2A classes if you can; it is more comfortable during long journeys. "General" class is not recommended in monsoon!
normalised: Remember to book tickets in three A or two A classes if you can; it is more comfortable during long journeys. "General" class is not recommended in monsoon!

unnormalised: Passengers are requested to bear with the inconvenience, as the Railways are working tirelessly to restore normalcy. Contact helpline no. 139 for any queries. Stay safe and happy journeying!
normalised: Passengers are requested to bear with the inconvenience, as the Railways are working tirelessly to restore normalcy. Contact helpline number one hundred and thirty nine for any queries. Stay safe and happy journeying!
